_header: Treat every man as he is disposed
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Everything draweþe to his semblable’ — twenty-five 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

BodAsh59.First Lines:
TRete every man as he is disposedWith holy men entrete of
                    holynesseþambissyous man loveþe to be glosedþe marcyal
                    prynce to here of his prowesse…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…Prerogatyff moste souereine of honourVn to his ymage list
                    make þee semblable
BodAsh59.Attributed Title:
Here nowe foloweþe a balade ryal made by Lydegate affter his resorte
                    to his religyoun. with þe refrayde / howe every thing draweþe to his
                    semblable (f. 18)
BodAsh59.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 801-8.

BLHar2251.First Lines:
Trete euery man like as he is disposedwith holy men trete of
                    parfitnesse…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…And by perogatives most souerayne of honoureTo his ymage list
                    make the semblable
